title.narrative: WASH OP 3 - SUSTAINABLE ACCESS TO SAFE WATER

description.narrative: Community demand for sustainable safe drinking water sources is improved and met, which contributes to Sanitation, Wash And Emergencies, Water, Water Supply. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By the end of 2020, households and communities have access to safe drinking water, sanitation, and healthy environments and good hygiene practices are equitably improved in target regions

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Community demand for sustainable safe drinking water sources is improved and met

description.narrative: UNICEF interventions in 2019 have provided new access to safe and sustainable drinking water to more than 89,900 people against a target of 43,000, giving a total of 747,619 since 2015. UNICEF's headline achievement: the inauguration of the 180km Ampotaka pipeline powered by solar energy in the south provides sustainable access to water for 35,000 people affected by chronic drought and impacted by climate change. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019
